articles.headline: Sri Lanka Attack Signals ISIS’ Widening Reach
articles.snippet: A month after losing the last of its territory in Iraq and Syria, the Islamic State is believed to have pulled off one of its deadliest attacks. It may be the way of the future.
articles.abstract: A month after losing the last of its territory in Iraq and Syria, the Islamic State is believed to have pulled off one of its deadliest attacks. It may be the way of the future.
articles.lead_paragraph: A bearded man wearing a heavy backpack and sandals walks deliberately across the courtyard of St. Sebastian’s Church in Sri Lanka on Easter Sunday. Moments later, he slips past the pews where women are sitting with their hair covered in veils of white lace, then detonates a bomb.
articles.byline: By Rukmini Callimachi and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: San Francisco Had an Ambitious Plan to Tackle School Segregation. It Made It Worse.
articles.snippet: A system devised to empower parents and integrate schools has not worked as intended, offering a cautionary tale to districts across the country.
articles.abstract: A system devised to empower parents and integrate schools has not worked as intended, offering a cautionary tale to districts across the country.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Like many parents in San Francisco, Melvin Canas and Delfina Ramirez described applying to public kindergarten as a part-time job. They researched schools all over the city for their daughter, Cinthya; took unpaid hours off their jobs as cooks to tour over a dozen; and ultimately ranked 15 of them on her application.

articles.headline: Joe Biden Expresses Regret to Anita Hill, but She Says ‘I’m Sorry’ Is Not Enough
articles.snippet: Former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. called Anita Hill this month to express his regret over “what she endured” testifying against Justice Clarence Thomas in 1991.
articles.abstract: Former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. called Anita Hill this month to express his regret over “what she endured” testifying against Justice Clarence Thomas in 1991.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Joe Biden knew Anita Hill was going to be an issue for him. So a few weeks ago, as he prepared for his presidential announcement, he reached out to her through an intermediary and arranged a telephone call, hoping to assuage her.
articles.byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Carl Hulse

articles.headline: Uber Said to Plan I.P.O. Price Range Valuing Company as High as $90 Billion
articles.snippet: The world’s largest ride-hailing company was said to be planning an initial pricing of $44 to $50 a share.
articles.abstract: The world’s largest ride-hailing company was said to be planning an initial pricing of $44 to $50 a share.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Uber plans to set a price range for its initial public offering that would value it at as much as $90 billion, a person with knowledge of the situation said on Thursday, in a sign of caution amid a flood of highly hyped tech offerings.

articles.headline: Regulators Around the World Are Circling Facebook
articles.snippet: Facebook revealed that it expected a record fine from the F.T.C. That could be one of many moves against the company by governments on four continents.
articles.abstract: Facebook revealed that it expected a record fine from the F.T.C. That could be one of many moves against the company by governments on four continents.
articles.lead_paragraph: Regulators on four continents are preparing for a long-awaited showdown with Facebook, after years of disinterest and half-steps.
articles.byline: By Cecilia Kang and Adam Satariano

articles.headline: Sri Lankan Accused of Leading Attacks Preached Slaughter. Many Dismissed Him.
articles.snippet: The man accused of masterminding the Easter Sunday attacks on churches and hotels never hid his hatred. “We all underestimated him,” a resident of his hometown said.
articles.abstract: The man accused of masterminding the Easter Sunday attacks on churches and hotels never hid his hatred. “We all underestimated him,” a resident of his hometown said.
articles.lead_paragraph: KATTANKUDY, Sri Lanka — Zaharan Hashim, a radical Muslim preacher accused of masterminding the Easter Sunday attacks on churches and hotels in Sri Lanka, never hid his hatred.

articles.headline: Phone Companies Are Testing Tech to Catch Spam Calls. Let’s Hope It Works.
articles.snippet: A new standard, called Stir/Shaken, could come to your mobile provider by the end of the year. But there are already ways around it.
articles.abstract: A new standard, called Stir/Shaken, could come to your mobile provider by the end of the year. But there are already ways around it.
articles.lead_paragraph: Anthony Marino set his mobile phone to “Do Not Disturb” before going to bed, but he sensed it flicker in the dark. The next morning, he saw he had missed roughly 30 calls: at 4:15 a.m., 4:34, 4:45, 5:08 and 5:12, and for two hours after that. Most appeared as “Lithuania” on his caller ID, although they could have come from anywhere.

articles.headline: U.S. and Japan Push for a Trade Deal Following Failed Pacific Partnership
articles.snippet: The United States and Japan could be headed toward a more limited deal that would help American farmers. The question is what Japan will demand in return.
articles.abstract: The United States and Japan could be headed toward a more limited deal that would help American farmers. The question is what Japan will demand in return.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump said on Friday that trade talks between the United States and Japan were “moving along very nicely” and suggested a deal might be reached by late May as he met with Shinzo Abe, the Japanese prime minister, at the White House.
articles.byline: By Ana Swanson, Mark Landler and Motoko Rich

articles.headline: Overcoming Doubts, U.S. Economy Finds a Way Forward
articles.snippet: A 3.2% growth rate in the first quarter beats the forecasts and offers Trump a political lift.
articles.abstract: A 3.2% growth rate in the first quarter beats the forecasts and offers Trump a political lift.
articles.lead_paragraph: Reports of the economic expansion’s death appear to have been greatly exaggerated.
articles.byline: By Ben Casselman and Jim Tankersley
